intro: Sida pires-blackii, commonly known as Pires-blackii sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that are clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
